name: n-hexyl acetate
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the n-hexyl group (C6H13) increases the molecular weight and size, which raises the melting point. The acetate group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The n-hexyl group also introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The net effect is a raised melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity but with a more significant contribution from the additional hydrogen bonding.
